I love Portal 2, it has great replayablity an incredible story and more to do when you beat it.
[h1]Do i Need to tell you buying it ?[/h1]

This... is a masterpiece. A significant improvement over Portal in both the storytelling and gameplay department. The puzzles were all fun and challenging- never did they require RNG or impossible-to-notice elements in order to solve puzzles unlike most other games nowadays. Puzzles had a clear, logical mindset that only required you to connect the dots in the right way at the right time.

There was no compromise in the storytelling department. It had an excellent story to share and it continued perfectly from Portal 1. I listened to the developer commentary and I appreciated all the little details the writers put into the story to make the gameplay and the story work seamlessly together. The character development and, spoiler, plot twist, was neat. Portal 2 is a prime example of how you create a world that blends both gameplay and storytelling together in a way that appeals to both types of people who play for either the story or the puzzles.

Until I get a VR headset and try out Half-Life Alyx, I am content with calling Portal 2 Valve's Magnum Opus.
